page.title: 17EDUCATION IN ROSSINGTON
page.content: There are approximately 2190 children between the ages of 5 and 18 years receiving education in Rossington. There is one comprehensive school,for pupils aged 12 to 18 years, which is the secondary school for children who attend the the two Middle Schools- Holmescarr and Pheasant Bank and the First and Middle School, St Michael's C.E. Children between 5 and 8 years attend Grange Lane and Tornedale First Schools and St Michael's. St Joseph's R.C. Primary School caters for Roman Catholic children of Rossington and the surrounding area. Pre-school education is given to 3+ years old at Grange Lane, Tornedale and St Joseph's Nurseries. Rossington Hall Special School is for children with learning difficulties.
